snippet: The archbishop of Canterbury, who earlier appeared to link gay rights to violence against Christians, spoke of mindfulness of global differences.
abstract: Archbishop of Canterbury Justin Welby, under fire for appearing to link expanded gay rights in United States to violence against Christians in Africa, says he is advocating for slow and deliberative response to same-sex marriage, mindful of global implications.

byline.original: By BEN FENWICK and MICHAEL PAULSON
byline.contributor: Ben Fenwick reported from Oklahoma City, and Michael Paulson from New York.

lead_paragraph: The archbishop of Canterbury, who earlier appeared to link gay rights to violence against Christians, spoke of mindfulness of global differences.

headline.main: Anglican Leader, Under Fire for Remarks, Urges Caution on Same-Sex Marriage
headline.print_headline: Anglican Leader, Under Fire for Remarks, Urges Caution on Same-Sex Marriage

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
